wikipedia_page.main: Jason Michael Holland (born 25 January 1971) is an English designer, university lecturer, writer and awards judge who created the 1997 website Head-Space, which is included in Management Today's Ten Websites That Changed the World, and is an acknowledged blueprint for intranets and a precursor to YouTube. Holland is also credited with a number of other interactive firsts.

response: * Jason Michael HollandDesign guru gives lectures at West Notts. Chad, 26 November 2014, p.47. Accessed 14 July 2021
